long_desc.thetext:
An exploitable command injection vulnerability exists in the gplotMakeOutput function of Leptonica 1.74.4. A specially crafted gplot rootname argument can cause a command injection resulting in arbitrary code execution. An attacker can provide a malicious path as input to an application that passes attacker data to this function to trigger this vulnerability.

External References:

https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2018-0516

Created leptonica tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1542007]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1542008]


Created mingw-leptonica tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1542009]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-7186 leptonica: Stack-based buffer overflows in gplotRead() and ptaReadStream() when parsing crafted files can lead to denial of service

long_desc.thetext:
leptonica through version 1.74.4 is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in gplot.c:gplotRead() and ptabasic.c:ptaReadStream() when parsing crafted files, leading to a denial of service.

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/DanBloomberg/leptonica/commit/ee301cb2029db8a6289c5295daa42bba7715e99a

Additional References:

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=890548

Created leptonica tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1542007]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1542008]


Created mingw-leptonica tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1542009]

bugs.title: CVE-2018-7247 leptonica: Unsanitized input in pixHtmlViewer in prog/htmlviewer.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-7247 leptonica: Unsanitized input in pixHtmlViewer in prog/htmlviewer.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-7247 leptonica: Unsanitized input in pixHtmlViewer in prog/htmlviewer.c

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in pixHtmlViewer in prog/htmlviewer.c in Leptonica before 1.75.3. An Unsanitized input (rootname) can overflow a buffer, thus potentially leading to arbitrary code execution or possibly other unspecified impact.


References:
https://github.com/DanBloomberg/leptonica/pull/309

Patch:
https://github.com/DanBloomberg/leptonica/commit/c1079bb8e77cdd426759e466729917ca37a3ed9f

bugs.title: CVE-2017-18196 leptonica: Mishandled pathnames in /tmp subdirectories can allow users to bypass intended file restrictions

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-18196 leptonica: Mishandled pathnames in /tmp subdirectories can allow users to bypass intended file restrictions

long_desc.thetext:
Leptonica 1.74.4 constructs unintended pathnames (containing duplicated path components) when operating on files in /tmp subdirectories, which might allow local users to bypass intended file restrictions by leveraging access to a directory located deeper within the /tmp directory tree.


Additional References:

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=885704

Created leptonica tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1549412]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1549411]
